Normally, I wouldn't have a problem with this if you are paying your wait staff a decent enough wage to give a crap about their job, but apparently that's not the case here. It's clear to me now that the reason the wait staff don't care about the service is because they have no incentive too.   I'm assuming this is what's going through the mind of the wait staff "You need a refill and it's been ten minutes since you went dry? Your plates are piling up and starting to glaze over after you've been done eating for half an hour and we haven't cleared them yet? You ask for your check and I don't pick it up for another 20 minutes to ring it through? I don't care, I don't get tips anyway so don't leave one"  It's my understanding that in the japenese culture wait staff are not tipped, and are not expected to be tipped. Which is fine, when, you're, in, japan. But the culture here is such that if the wait staff aren't getting their tips, it will show in the service they provide, and it's my humble suggestion that this restaraunt figures out a way to make it worth your wait staffs while to actually try harder. If the wait staff are incentivized properly and actually have a stake in customers returning to eat there again, the business will profit from it. If the wait staff stays like they currently are, customers will continue to be driven away and business will be lost. I hate saying it, but my two friends that I came with said "Kyle, I don't know why you took us here, but we're not coming here again", which makes me very sad. I live close, so I will still return, but two potential customers were last that night, just think about how many more you'll keep losing if things don't change?

Delicious!!! Read the reviews and decided to check this place out. The menu was intense. Lots of great rolls to choose from. We didn't venture far from our usual favorites but guarantee the next time we return we will try all different rolls. The Volcano, Yellowtail Sashimi, and Soft Shell Crab were worthy of the 5 stars. Let's see we had about 3 rolls each and sake and the bill was under $50. Had we brought the coupon we printed out and of course left on our kitchen table, we could have saved $7. By the end of the night our belly's were full and our wallets didn't have to take a beating. Overall it was a great night.

This is the best sushi restraunt I've been to.  Jason and Nick are the sushi chefs and they are incredible. Not your average sushi chefs. These guys take sushi to a whole new level. All of the rolls are great and sashimi is super fresh! Cute lil restraunt I .will definitely be back.

Mediocre food and even more mediocre service. I went here with a friend last night and I was extremely disappointed to say the least. The service, first and foremost, was extremely lackluster. We may have been seated quickly but our waitress and "service" was almost non-existent. We never got refills for our drinks, food took forever to come out, and our waitress never checked on our table after our original order was taken. I was really underwhelmed by the gyoza and I felt like the noodles I had were somewhat slimy and somewhat overcooked. My friend's roll orders looked to be far better than mine, but I'm also not a sushi person. I'm sorely disappointed by the fact that our waitress could check on every table but ours it seemed and that I had to flag down two other waitresses to get the check and send my very dry chicken order back. The first waitress I politely asked if she could get our waitress for us. She never did. The second waitress I just politely asked to get the check, send back the dry chicken, and get to go boxes. I've ordered to go here before and I thought they were slow just getting a to go order out. Now I realize they're just slow in general. I think this will be my first and last physical outing at Sushiya.

Stopped in for lunch with a co worker. We were promptly greeted and sat at the bar. We choose the two rolls for 9.00 lunch special. Sushi was out fast and tasted good. Great deal for lunch prices. Atmosphere was fine except sound seems to carry and there was table with squealing toddlers that was annoying.
We go to Sushiya atleast 2 to 3 times a month....    we love the selection of rolls wenhav3 to chose from and the price is very reasonable.....

Checked out this place for dinner last night with my daughters and their friends after reading great reviews on yelp. I called ahead and the wait time was 20-25 mins and asked to be put on waiting list for 5 people and we would be there in 10 minutes. They said they would call out my name once a table is open. Came there and waited out side in their waiting area since their waiting area inside had only 2 seats and was already occupied. After waiting 40+ minutes and seeing people leave and people that arrived after us being seated, I came in to ask when our table would be ready. They apologized and got a table ready for us within 5 minutes. Since we waited so long I already checked out their menu and started putting in orders. Our order came out fast, and mostly everything was good. We were thrown off by their calamari since it was the size of onion rings and not the little ones we're used to getting. Other then that and the waiting confusion it was great. Prices were decent for all their menu items.

HORRIBLE SERVICE AND MEDIOCRE FOOD. We waited 10 minutes at our table before the server even took our order. Then, we waited an additional 45 minutes for our food, at which point we had to ask 3 times on the status of our order. The server had clearly forgotten to put in the other half of our order, but refused to admit to it. Instead of listening to us when we told her to just cancel our order, they proceeded to put the food on our table and charge us! We could not get out of that place faster ...  Don't waste your time here.

The good: Good food!  The bad: Waiter handled the drinking cups by the top edge where guests put their mouths to drink.     Found a hair on one of the dining plates.   Tops of the drinking glasses were super rough because they were used to gather ice from the ice bucket.   Waiter didn't know what was in a lot of the dishes.   Waitress wasn't sure what she brought when she served the food.   Would I go again? No.
Regrettably, we got some really old fish for lunch last week. Left most of it on the plates. We were regulars until this unfortunate event. Time to find another sushi place!

So this spot was really hard for me to find idk why haha, when I got in I didn't really have any expectations, the place is small and cute, the waitress was very nice, I ordered the sushi rolls with my friends which all were in very reasonable prices despite the time of the day it wasn't happy hour or anything, and when I started eating I was very impressed with the sushi! It was so good! I defiantly recommend this spot if you want to try super good sushi that isn't so expensive. Seriously wow!

When we arrived on a Sunday evening, an older man "greeted" us at the door.  I say "greeted" because I don't even think he made eye contact with us - instead he just grunted and said "two?" Then he dropped two menus off at the sushi bar and walked away... okaaaaayyyyy.....  Luckily, the young waitresses who helped us were very pleasant and generally attentive. The guys at the sushi bar weren't very friendly, but I assume they were focused on sushi rolling!   Average sushi - nothing spectacular, but good enough that I might return every once in a while.  We tried three different rolls, but to be honest, they all started tasting the same!  The jalapeno roll was our favorite, the ASU roll was okay but a little heavy on the crab.  Since Happy hour is EVERY DAY!! (woo) we started with the veggie tempura.  For the price, you get a rather large portion, but it was very very bland.  I don't think the tempura batter had any salt.

So far the food is good. As far as Jafar behind the counter I was apprehensive at first. It turns out he really knows what he is doing, from marinating flavors and using an ice smoker for smoked lobster and crab. I want to come back and try that and give a different review. Which means the makeral was decent, the octopus and roe were hefty portions and the not chewy. They also have the elusive asahi black. Best beer to have with sushi.  My complaints are the edamame. If you like it melted then try it. However I like mine very raw or aldente. It was terrible although the taste of the garlic was still great.   Lastly the bathroom was dusty. Dust that fake plant.
Our favorite place for sushi. Nice little place and mostly packed every time we visit. Very fresh sashimi. The sashimi salad is flavorful and tasty.

Got the spicy salmon roll and the 2-pc squid roll. Amazing flavor and healthy! Full after just this. Chef was really nice and actually conversational. The butane torch burning of the top of the squid roll was pretty legit too. Quiet atmosphere; went during lunch hour.

This place always has coupons for lunch, 15% off dinner, and great deals in your local coupon booklet so make sure to grab one before you go. In case you forget, don't sweat it. They have this great special for $20 where you can choose 3 rolls and it comes with edamame and miso soup. I am not sure how they can deliver taste and freshness with their low prices, but somehow they get it done. Everything tastes very fresh. They get pretty busy so make sure that you are patient. Their service is great though and I always leave happily full.

We just tried Sushiya for the first time, to say we are impressed is an understatement. We LOVE it. Very fresh, tasty rolls, fast, friendly service. This is officially our favorite sushi place. We plan to be 'regulars'.

We have been to Sushiya a couple of times and have left happy each time.  My wife an I enjoy the good sleaction of rolls and our kids are always treated well by the staff.  The unique kids desserts they come up with have them asking to go back often.  The happy hour prices are great with pretty good options for rolls.  The only negative and or request I have is that Sushiya really needs to incorporate a water filter as the water they serve is absolutly undrinkable...

Good sushi and good happy hour selection. My wife really enjoyed the red bean ice cream.  A ton of spicy selections, too. The beef sushi was smoky and so tender it was almost buttery.  The lobster and crab was pretty good too. Service was hit and miss; very attentive at times, but noticeable absences.  Really wanted to give them 5 stars, but didn't quite make it tonight.

They changed the wait staff. From the little blonde white girls to little Asian girls that are MUCH WORSE.   By far the worst service at any Restaurant you will find in Gilbert. Especially if you go at anytime where more than 4 tables are taken up.  No more special desserts, no more hellos from the owner, no more great sushi, they apparently lost their good Sushi Chef and the two guys working back there now are just too inconsistent. Sometimes you will get a decent roll but this last time, the Sushi was just falling apart all over the place.  Fried Vegas rolls, COLD. miso Soup flavorless, Bathroom and Hallways Disgusting.  BAD BAD BAD.   After coming here for 2yrs and probably 12x, we are done.

I'm giving this place 5 stars on the quality of the sushi,  I came here for lunch when on business and saw all the good ratings here so decided to give it a try.  First off is don't come on Monday for lunch they are closed.  Second, be prepared to wait a bit for your order and items to come.  I'm ok with that to a point  because I think they really spend the time to prepare everything so it comes out nice.  But the woman working there seems not  to know many answers to the questions I had. She really could not answer which fish are in which selection.  She kept leaving and coming back to give me answers but between that and handling all the other tables it got to be a long wait to get everything.  So on to my sushi order. When I first got my order I was a little surprised of the selection I got, it was mostly different types of tuna.  I had red tuna, white tuna, albacore (a tuna), yellowtail, spicy tuna rolls, and 1 salmon sushi and a california fake crab like sushi, and a shrimp sushi (Ebi).  All the fish tasted really good though, the white tuna melted in my mouth. The spicy tuna is made a little different than at most places.  They chop it in pieces and and kind of float it over rice rolls. Very good but would have liked a little more spice. The sushi chef was very nice but seemed a little serious at the same time.  He would keep asking if everything was ok, and I just kept saying everything was fine as I tried to sneak in a picture of my dish. I don't know why but somehow It felt like I was committing an illegal act..  Anyway, 5 stars for the great food and 4 stars for the the little things that I think that could improve.
Our fav sushi bar!  Awesome rolls. Great prices for the quality and the service is PHENOMINAL!  We'd eat here everday if we could!

Thanks for all the previous reviews! Just ate here for Happy Hour and the food was great! All the rolls were delicious! Especially the Arizona Roll! Fast friendly service! I recommend this to anyone wanting great sushi at affordable prices!  Will be back again soon!

I wish were able to rate places on service separately. The sushi is great but service was just horrible tonight and no excuse for it. I would understand if they were busy and running around like crazy people but it was pretty dead tonight. Two young teens were trying to be our servers. I didn't see the woman I usually see, whom I assume is the owner?  The girls never verified our order and never once checked on us. My friends order wasn't correct and they were surprised when she said she wanted what she originally ordered. She didn't touch the food she didn't order. Then we never got refills. I only got a refill when the girl brought us our check. It literally took them an hour to finally come and take our cards. Again. Not busy at all. Anytime I would see one of the girls walking towards us, we would try to get their attention. Instead they would look to the ground and go to another table. I was very disappointed. I've been here often and even on busy weekends and never ever had this bad of an experience. It sucks because the sushi is delicious and prices are fair. But the service is most definitely slacking.
This place sucks now. I think they are under new management, because the sushi just isn't the same. My friend got really bad food poisoning here too.

Close to Chandler-Gilbert Community College. Nice atmosphere. Good sushi.  I like their smoked salmon nigiri, and my fiance said their squid is very good.  Service can be a little off sometimes.  On two different occasions, the waitress brought me someone else's food.  Weird.
Quintessential AZ sushi... Not very fresh or particularly flavorful, but will do if not feeling picky... Happy hour prices are good

Went here last night with family and the food was great!  rolls were very good, we had the Arizona, dragon, soft shell crab, and cal roll with baked scallops.  All were very good, and you cant beat the prices here.  My wife had the yaki udon noodle dinner, that was ok.  Thats the only reason why we gave 4 stars.  But hey, this is a sushi bar.  Will def. be back and soon!
This food was fantastic, service very timely and friendly, seating comfortable not on top of one another. The sushi is fresh and portions generous. We will be frequenting this place.

The BF and I went to a movie last night down at the Hollywood theatres and figured we'd get there a couple hours early and walk around..... wrong. There's not much around there. So we started driving south and stopped in the parking lot of Sushiya to figure out what to do. Well, we hadn't eaten yet, but only wanted something really light and decided to give Sushiya a try. I'm glad we did! The place was really busy, especially for 9 o clock at night. We ended up eating at the sushi bar, which was cool because we got to watch all the sushi be made. We just ordered a house salad, the inari and cucumber rolls. The salad was nothing special, just the typical salad. The real special thing was the inari.... it was the best I have ever tasted! They make what our Sushi chef called 'special rice' which has green onion and ginger in it. It made it have this perfect sweet and savory taste. I would come back just for that. The service was good and the sushi chef was friendly. Overall, it was a nice place..... I would go back just for the inari.... yum.

Walked in...walked out...  We walked in and the hostess was talking to her friend. He mumbled something to us..not sure if it meant i'll be there..or take a seat...either way...after her friend left, she looked at us from across the room and she yelled across the room "I said any seat" with some nasty manor isms.    We just left...  They lost our business, i'm sure their sushi is awesome, but I enjoy a good experience as well.  Overall: If you like being treated like scum, this is the place for you.
I love this place! Such a great find with a fantastic variety of high quality sushi. Family owned and wonderful atmosphere!

Can't count how many times I've been there over the years - Always enjoyed going with my family. *Kid friendly - there will be kids. *Best prices in town, really!  *D√©cor: Average, nothing fancy. *Good quality sushi. *Can be crowded at the dinner hour, go early and there is no wait. *I  generally order only sushi -  since the tempura tasted like it was microwaved frozen food (have ordered only twice) I just stay with the sushi. *The seaweed salad is one of my favorites. *Incredible happy hour deals on sake, beer, etc.                           One of the best kept secrets in Gilbert!!!

Tried four different rolls, all four were good and fairly cheap.   The arizona roll is by far my favorite, the phoenix roll was my least favorite.   Its a small place, they try to move you through the place as fast as possible, but then they bring out one roll at a time every 5-10 min. I would rather have all four rolls brought to me at the same time. Ill make that clear next time.   I recommend this place if you want good/cheap sushi.

Don't let the look of this small hole in the wall sushi place scare you away! This place is amazing. Not only does everything always taste ridiculously fresh but the are so many options to choose from. They are always adding new specialty rolls onto their menus so if you are an adventurous eater there is always something new to try. The place is very small and can get pretty busy on a night but during lunch it is a small quiet space to come grab a quick bite. I have been here multiple times and always try something new and am never disappointed. The wait staff are always friendly and knowledgeable about the items on the menus as well. This is one of my favorite sushi places.

I've been here several times, each time really enjoyed the food. The sushi always was very flavorful and fresh. The only thing that I felt needed work was the service. The wait staff is friendly, but there has been more than one occasion where it too took an incredibly long time for our sushi to come. Its frustrating when customers come in 15 minutes after you and they get their food first (I was at a table of 4 and they had 4).

A few friends of ours kept mentioning this place so we decided to check it out one day. We walked in and there were 2 women standing by a computer in the back, we stood awkwardly just inside for a bit before deciding to walk back there and ask to be seated. The decor is a bit tacky for my taste and the place is pretty small.   I have to say that their specials are awesome. The 3 rolls for $20 is a steal! However, it only comes with 1 miso, which would have been nice to know when we ordered it. We weren't impressed with their miso. We ordered a Las Vegas roll, 2 Rainbow rolls, salmon and yellowtail sashimi. The rainbow roll was good, the Vegas roll had shrimp in it, which is really odd. My husband's allergic to shellfish so we're usually pretty good about subbing in different things. Thankfully I tried the Vegas Roll first. It wasn't something I'd order again. The salmon sashimi was decent, their rice was a bit overcooked and had too much vinegar in it. The yellowtail was exceptional, some of the best we've had actually.   All in all we'd come here again during happy hour, but I wouldn't pay full price for anything but the yellowtail.
The code blue roll and spicy salmon are my favorites. Can't beat the happy hour! This is one of our all time favorite sushi places to go.

This our go to place near home. We're here every other Friday or so. To start, they have a late happy hour. 7:30. That alone is a perfect reason to go. Especially after work on a Friday. The service. If you go when I do, Friday at 6:30, there may be a wait to be seated but they keep it moving and communicate well. The sushi bar sometimes gets backed up but, again, the servers communicate well and check on you often. I say "servers" because they do this odd thing where they share tables. It confused me at first, but I got used to it and now I even like it. It's super easy to get someone's attention. The owner/manager walks around and asks you how everything is and is super friendly.  The food is pretty good.  The fish is fresh and well cut. The kitchen items are really nice. The salmon belly sushi is awesome (I normally do not like salmon) and a steal at 4 bucks. The salmon skin roll is also really well done, and under 4 on happy hour. The bluefin is a fair price but pure loin meat with no fat. If you like red meat tuna it's certainly worth 6. The grilled tilapia belly is a hit with my daughter and wife, but not me. Just personal taste. If you like the eel, this appetizer would be squarely in your wheelhouse. The value can't be beat. Happy hour is basically all the way through dinner (and reverse happy hour starts right after) the prices are actually lower than most sushi bars. My bill here is normally less than most sit-down chain restaurants.  Even though I'm positive on most aspects, Sushiya somehow has that magic quality of being greater than the sum of its parts. My whole family loves going here and will be regulars forever. It's a real gem.

I love sushi, when I read the reviews about this place most of them were accuret. We had gotten poor service and took them forever to get our rolls of sushi out. I do recommend getting the tiger eye roll everything else I ordered was just okay.

I used to go there once a week for lunch then now only once in a while. I tried their rolls and they are good, just a bit thin for my taste so now I just get a couple of hand rolls which are a better value for me ($3.50) and a California roll ($2.50) to make sure I won't be starved in the next hour or so.  The place is small but the owner is always nice. The staff can be hit or miss, sometimes slow sometimes ok. They have coupons online that you can get but cannot use them for Happy Hour.  Prices are pretty fair for what you get however you might have better options in the neighborhood.  All in all, I don't mind to stop by once in a while and get a sushi fix.
